intro: Ancistragrostis, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in wetlands and along the edges of streams. Ancistragrostis is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to attract pollinators.
